text: Ian Stocker working his magic on the GBA once again. I have a confession to make... I have never played a Sims game. Mostly because it's simply not the type of game I want to spend hours on. I recently got into some of the series' music however and I can't deny it has some quality and standout tracks.
author: SupraDarky

text: Weird as it sounds, Sims:BO is less  a Sims game and more an adventure game crossed with a dating sim, so even if you were a Sim-thuciast, you likely would have missed this a̶b̶o̶m̶i̶n̶a̶t̶i̶o̶n̶ visionary game.
author: Jacob Miller

text: There are plenty of Sims games that are far from the simulation type game. A lot of portable Sims games are weird adventure games pretty enjoyable. But if I had to recommand you one and only one Sims-branded game, it would be MySims Agents on Wii. The whole MySims franchise has nothing to do with a simulation game, and is great in my opinion. MySims Agents is an amazing puzzle-adventure game with an intelligent story and a lot of humor. It worth a shot (soundtrack is good too, especially for MySims Kingdom.. Shinji Hosoe and Ayako Saso did MySims Party's Wii soundtrack!)
author: Mattrio

text: sims 1 and 2 have amazing osts
author: OfficialAbass

text: If you find some free time I actually suggest the Game Boy Advanced versions of The Sims. It's an entirely different ball game. They are more adventure games than life simulators. I thoroughly enjoyed them as a kid. Busting Out and The Urbz gave me some great memories.
